website_summaries.verdict: An excellent supplement to more comprehensive PMP exam prep guides; one that may prepare students a little too well for Earned Value questions.
pros: Covers the Earned Value portion of the PMP exam well, with relevant and challenging practice questions
Most find this prepares them well for E.V
cons: Doesn’t match every student’s learning style
Some feel that it is too much prep for just a few E.V

customer_reviews.title: Expert guide to master Earned Value in a short period of time for the PMP exam!
customer_reviews.text: I recently passed the PMP exam with the expert guidance of Aileen Ellis' trio of books: How to get every earned value question right on the PMP exam, How to get every network diagram question right on the PMP exam and How to get every contract calculation question right on the PMP exam. Each book is a quick read establishing parallels between theory and practice. The sample questions spanned the most basic concepts to the most complex. Utilizing Aileen's books give me the confidence needed to pass complex areas of the exam in a short period of time. I highly recommend these books to anyone requiring focus on these aspects of the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Drema D.

customer_reviews.title: The entire book is like a small book with one question on each page
customer_reviews.text: The entire book is like a small book with one question on each page. Just to get practice....However, it would have been much better with detailed explanations because many times I couldn't tell why I got the answer wrong and how to fix it. You'll do much better with a more detailed book because these questions are not that easy to figure out. Hope this helps. Good luck if you're taking the PMP exam!
customer_reviews.author: Lana L.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Just finished the book and got just about all the questions correct. Some are simple, some are a bit more challenging. What the book does, it gets you familiar with the formulas and how to apply them. Learning by doing. Would love to have a summary questions edition for most other topics as well. Will I get every earned value question right on the exam? Who knows, but if I don’t, it will be because I failed to read the questions throughly, not because taking 53 practice question wasn’t adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Dude

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! Another great book from Aileen in her ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! Another great book from Aileen in her series of PMP books. I hate memorising equations, I want to understand what it actually means then I don't have to memorise it at all. Aileen explained everything so clearly and made it so easy to understand. I'm very grateful that I came across her books, a real godsend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book gives you a very good detail on how to solve the question
customer_reviews.text: 1 of those Books that you just have to say "Thank God it exist." I took the exam and failed. I realizing that some of the areas I had issues with was, understanding some minor details such us the EV test questions. Practicing more on this are would have made a huge difference on my exam in my result. I have gotten at least 40 questions on EV, if only I focus on this more. This book gives you a very good detail on how to solve the question. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Maimunatu22

customer_reviews.title: No More Fear of Calculation Questions on the PMP Exam
customer_reviews.text: You can clear the earned value questions on the PMP exam by following Aileen's formulas in this book. When I first started studying, I was overwhelmed by all the formulas I needed to learn and when to apply which ones. I ordered this book and completed it within a couple days. By applying her formulas on the cost questions, I was now scoring up in the 80's and 90's on my practice tests. Other PMP prep materials don't cover the material as succinct as Aileen's book does. Go with this book instead of any others. Simply put, this book will help get you to your final destination - passing the PMP exam!
customer_reviews.author: SCSU Grad

customer_reviews.title: This was obviously one of the best books I've found in preparing for EVM questions
customer_reviews.text: This was obviously one of the best books I've found in preparing for EVM questions. After months and months of trying to learn these formulas, this book nailed it for me in one day. However, one suggestion is that Aileen Ellis revise their method of explaining EAC. I knew the formulas, but the explanations, to me, were a bit confusion. After a quick googling online, I found a very good explanation laid out. But, this books questions really enabled me to understand and apply EVM much better.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Although my BA is in Mathematics, using these manuals is like having her expertise right there as you study.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased all the How to get every question right by author Aileen Ellis. These products are golden. Using these manuals is like having her expertise right there as you study. You will also find that she makes herself available if needed by email. Truly an artist of program or project management. Her expertise, knowledge, and willingness to help those on this path is simply outstanding and I am humbled by her awesomeness in this area. She is truly a Subject matter expert. MUST purchase if the PMP is your destination.
customer_reviews.author: RK Smith

customer_reviews.title: Light Bulbs On!
customer_reviews.text: Aileen provided certain explanations that connected the dots for me in helping me not only memorize EVM formulas but also know when to use which formulas that could otherwise be tricky if/when you have a choice on the exam. Thank you Aileen! (I used this in conjunction with Rita's PMP Exam Prep Book.)
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Ms Ellis provides a clear understanding of the concept of EVA, making use of graphics to assist. This eliminates the need to learn all of the formulas since one can work out what is needed simply by drawing the graph representing the information provided in the question and determining what is required to find the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Great book to understand PMP calculations
customer_reviews.text: Must buy for anyone sitting for the PMP exam!! After reading both the Andy Crowe and Rita Mulcahy's books, I needed a condensed and very direct approach to understanding EV calculations. This book is GREAT!! Lots of questions along with answers to study and improve. After taking several prep exams, I feel this book helped me pass calculations with flying colors. It is well worth the money!! Thanks Aileen for a simplistic and organized book to pass calculations.
customer_reviews.author: vca

customer_reviews.title: Good theory, but lacks some variety
customer_reviews.text: I think the book fulfills its promise of helping understand the EVM questions. However, all the questions are very similar, and it becomes somewhat repetitive. Also I think there should be a little more explanation on certain questions. And i think on the exam (have not done it yet) the questions will be more complicated (I am thinking they will be more like the bonus questions).
customer_reviews.author: Luis Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Great mini-book. I passed my PMP exam today
customer_reviews.text: Great mini-book. I passed my PMP exam today. Not sure why a few people are complaining about this book but i found it really useful and relevant towards passing my PMP. Thanks Aileen Ellis
customer_reviews.author: mopson

customer_reviews.title: Useful for the practice questions
customer_reviews.text: Useful for the practice questions. The author has some good youtube vids. Most of the material is available elsewhere, but I bought it for the practice question. Make sure you have memorized the equations before you try the practice questions
customer_reviews.author: Craig B

customer_reviews.title: Every bit worth it
customer_reviews.text: EVM calculations all seemed like a blur until i read this book. It was very helpful in not only from the numerous practice questions and detailed answer but also from the understanding of the logic behind EVM calculations which is more important that memorizing. This book has made EVM questions such a piece of cake! I would highly recommend this book. Worth every dime
customer_reviews.author: jshan

customer_reviews.title: Great workbook
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent workbook to practice PMP Earned Value questions only. The explanations are very detailed and it helps me to understand why I picked the wrong answer. The beginning introduces all possible formulas as well as a link to a video that was taken at one of her live prep courses. Cost was my biggest concern because I am not good at math, however, now I hope I will have lots of EV questions on my exam. Once you understand the formulas, it is really easy. My exam is scheduled and I can highly recommend this book for practicing purposes.
customer_reviews.author: catty

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BOOK
customer_reviews.text: Used this book for the Earned Value formulas and it was great. I passed my PMP on the first try and this book was a huge asset.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Great for PMP Math Qs!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is really awesome...and the YouTube that it syncs you up w makes understanding the math soo easy to understand for the test. If you take the bootcamp - all the teachers just zip right trough. This book and youtube videos are really well work the purchase....I did Kindle so it was a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: christine kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book.
customer_reviews.text: Great read. Greasy variety of questions and solutions to cover all the bases. Even though I need to work on remembering the equations, my confidence and understanding of the content is much greater. Thank you for writing this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I faced the PMP exam and passed it. All the questions that are there in this book simply helps the reader to be prepared for any type of question. This book helped me to increase my confidence for these type of questions. Its funny, but I was longing for question in this format because I was soo confidant. The author has provided help links, even demos, which is very helpful. I would recommend any one who is planning to face the PMP exam to go though this book any time :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Book = Passed on the First Attempt
customer_reviews.text: This book along with How To Get Every Network Diagram Question Right on the PMP and the PMP Exam Simplied were key to me passing the exam on the first attempt. I felt extremely confident (almost overly prepared) given many of the sample questions in all three books are complex and assess your ability to retain the key concepts and apply sound programmatic logic to the problem. I breezed through every network diagram and earned value question. I scored proficient in four of the five domain areas and had approx 30 minutes remaining at the end of the exam to review marked questions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Its useless without a toc or index. It's just jumbled all together. I have no reason to believe there's anything wrong with it otherwise, just highly unorganized.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well explained. Took the fear out of those questions.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Compagnoni Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Best preparation for EVM formulas for your PMP Exam
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend to everyone preparing to take their PMP exam, to get this Aileen Ellis book and you be have 100% confidence on all the EVM questions and formula and YOU WILL get every Earned Value question right on your PMP exam.

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It even had quizzes to test what you've learnef

customer_reviews.title: You will understand Earned Value after reading this book.
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the best book for learning Earned Value. It helped me pass the PMP exam on my first try. I went through other books, but this one was easier to understand the concept. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: paulmer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I passed the PMP exam no problem with the help of this book (and two others by Aileen Ellis). It was so helpful! Do yourself a favor and memorize the equations prior to the exam and practice!

customer_reviews.title: Eileen breaks it down and makes it so easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I just passed the PMP yesterday, and I am so thankful for Aileen's books! I had studied for 7 months, and Earned Value is a tough topic. Eileen breaks it down and makes it so easy to understand. I do feel confident that I answered every earned value question on the exam correctly. Eileen also has a You Tube video on earned value that makes the concept so easy to understand. She is a wonderful teacher, and I do highly recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: The only fun part of the test were all the EVM questions ...
customer_reviews.text: Just passed the PMP test last night - it was brutal! The only fun part of the test were all the EVM questions - they were easy and I give credit to Aileen for making them so. If it wasn't for the practice and the detailed explainations I wouldn't have been so well prepared. Definately buy this book and use it - you will be very glad you did.

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to learn and practice EVM concepts
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and simple presentation of what is necessary to know, and more than sufficient amount of examples to practice on.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I need and excellent shipment! From everything that I have read, this is a good book. I definitely recommend it to all.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't taken the test yet, so we'll see. Subject matter is presented in easy to understand format. Answers to questions are thoroughly explained. I feel confident about EVM questions...as long as I remember the formulas. Update: Ppassed the test. This book was very helpful.

customer_reviews.text: This works! Passed the PMP yesterday. These questions were more difficult than what was on my exam. I was well prepared after doing these exercises.

customer_reviews.text: This book helped me very much in preparing for my PMP exam. The explanations for each answer are thorough and helpful.

customer_reviews.title: I DID get every EV question correct!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a math person. This section of the PMP really made me nervous. But in the practice exams, I really did get every question correct. The video that comes with this book helped me to logically understand EV instead of just memorizing formulas. Memorization only works if you also know logically when to use which formula.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book

customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool for understanding the EVM formulas. Did the job I needed it to do and got my brain working! Thank you

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Short and concise, clearly explained the material and practice ...
customer_reviews.text: Short and concise, clearly explained the material and practice helped to enforce understanding and memorization of concepts. I used this book as part of my prep to pass PMP exam.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Explained!
customer_reviews.text: I gave the e-book a 5 star because it carefully dissected the many nuances of earned value through the questions. The solutions were also thoroughly explained.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Hi Aileen Ellis, I have a question, on ...
customer_reviews.text: Hi Aileen Ellis, I have a question, on the question 18, you indicated the BAC of the activities K,L, M. In my opinion, The BAC is only used for project, according to the PMBOK - page 224 BAC is "The value of total planned work, the project cost baseline." Can you explain the definition for the BAC of activities please?
customer_reviews.author: Tran Hai Dang

customer_reviews.title: Clear and concise
customer_reviews.text: Book is short but focus on building confident in the area of EVM. Questions are quite repetitive but they make sure that you will get it right on the real exam. Recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and good!
customer_reviews.text: Wanna get EVM and pass all its questions? Then stop worrying, get this book and secure this topic, for your PMP but also for your future PM tasks. Simple straight forward book. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: This book broke down complex formulas into easy to understand ideas
customer_reviews.text: This book broke down complex formulas into easy to understand ideas. As Aileen nearly promises, I think I got every EV question on the PMP exam correct with the help of this book!

customer_reviews.title: This book works
customer_reviews.text: Just passed my PMP exam and am so glad that I invested in this book. Very easy to understand and it worked -- I'm pretty sure I got every earned value question right. If only I had a book like this on critical path methodology!

customer_reviews.text: Excellent no-frills resource for mastering the EVM portion of the PMP certification exam. Questions on the exam (passed on 11 DEC 2014) were easier than her examples. Also, be sure to review the three bonus questions at the end; one question on my exam was very similar in format to the first bonus question. I utilized several resources to study for the exam; this was by far the best (and cheapest).

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent resource. I used this book for PMP studies ...
customer_reviews.text: For individuals who have limited or no experience with earned value management, this is an excellent resource. I used this book for PMP studies and recently passed the PMP exam on my first attempt where I had over 15 questions related to EVM. The book offers a clear and basic understanding of definitions while providing 50 questions backed up with excellent descriptive answers for each individual question. Highly recommended for those needing practice in EVM prior to taking the PMP exam.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Luce

customer_reviews.title: Helped me a lot for my PMP exam
customer_reviews.text: The best book explaining all concepts on earned value and many practice questions
customer_reviews.author: chandrasekar balasubramanian

customer_reviews.title: This book is not bad. But when you start using the book
customer_reviews.text: This book is not bad. But when you start using the book, you realize that there is a mistake with the solution of problem #1 itself. There is a graphical representation of EV, PV and AC. If you assume the values of EV,PV and AC from the graph, then the calculated SPI and CPI is under 1. That indicates the project is over the budget and behind schedule and the answer should be (d) and not (b) as indicated. I am also using Alieen's other book for my PMP preparation and I will post a detail review about it in the customer review section.
customer_reviews.author: SMart83

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book from cover to cover...just what I was looking for in regards to EV calcs!
customer_reviews.author: Lily Lee

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value for Earned Value Management from Aileen Ellis!
customer_reviews.text: This is one more excellent publication from Aileen Ellis. Aileen turns Earned Value Management, one of the most difficult areas of project management, into a surprisingly simple one to understand. The video included as part of the publication is a real benefit, giving a great quick overview to the topic. Aileen provides much more than just formulas for the Earned Value Managment portion of the exam, but also the logic behind the formulas, helping to make the formulas almost redundant.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Tom John

customer_reviews.title: The PMP candidates I tutor LOVE this e-book!!
customer_reviews.text: I specialize in tutoring PMP Exam Candidates one on one and without question one of the toughest areas is Earned Value. As part of my tutoring I have made it a requirement for my students to use this e-book by Aileen and every single one of my students has raved about it saying that it really helped them answer the PMP questions on Earned Value. I highly recommend it. Dan Ryan, PMP (www.thepmtutor.com)
customer_reviews.author: dmarie

customer_reviews.title: Understand EVM in 50 Questions!
customer_reviews.text: Great book and easy to understand. I had no clue about EVM, and this book walked me through example after example of how to apply EVM. There are a few twists that made me think, and when I saw and EVM question on the exam, I didn't flinch. This book prepared me to answer all of the PMP exam questions with ease. I highly encourage anybody who has trouble understanding EVM to buy this book. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: L. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Buy this book!
customer_reviews.text: Just passed the PMP exam this weekend. Definitely got every Earned Value question correct...with the help of this great little book! Highly recommend!

customer_reviews.text: Aileen has a real gift for making the complicated understandable. Great book for anyone hoping to master EVM!

Although the book is cheaply priced, don't buy it unless you are simply looking for questions (you can find numerous questions FREE online) to hone your EV skills.

customer_reviews.author: VINCE
